thread.title: Kenya: 'World's Smallest' Pocket Computer Arrives in Kenya
thread.title_full: Kenya: 'World's Smallest' Pocket Computer Arrives in Kenya

title: Kenya: 'World's Smallest' Pocket Computer Arrives in Kenya
text:
Somalia: British Forces to Help AU Fight Al-Shabaab By Moses Omusolo 
The world's smallest and lightest pocket computer is set to enter the Kenyan market in two weeks' time. 
With the proliferation of smartphones in Kenya, there is a general attitude that the ubiquitous CPU will fade faster than ever imagined. 
But not just yet. Here is so far the "world's smallest and lightest" pocket computer. 
AIR PC 
This fully functional Air PC by Panache is expected to revolutionise the way Kenyans work and play. 
"It's everything you love about your desktop computer in a device that fits in the palm of your hand," said the Panache Chief Executive Officer Manoj Nair. 
Mr Nair added that the device will retail at Sh20, 000. 
"To get a complete experience from an ultra-small, power efficient device that is just four inches long, simply connect your monitor or TV, keyboard and mouse with the Air PC and you are ready to go," he said. 
Powered by Windows 10 and Intel Quadcore Processor, the CPU comes with a one-year replacement warranty, 32 GB internal storage, expandable storage of up to 128 GB, Wi-Fi 802.11, Bluetooth 4.0; HDMI, Micro USB, as well as a USB 2.0 port. Kenya
